snippet: In "Changsha," Rian Dundon's series from the Chinese city where he lived, the place becomes somewhat lost. The images are part of a personal narrative, scenes culled from experience.
abstract: In "Changsha," Rian Dundon's series from the Chinese city where he lived, the place becomes somewhat lost. The images are part of a personal narrative, scenes culled from experience.

headline.main: China: Up Close, Personal, in Flux
